info.name: VolunteerSync API
info.description: VolunteerSync API - Complete REST API documentation with JWT authentication, security features, and all modules including support messages, event attendance, and certificates.

request.description:
### Login User

Authenticates a user and returns a JWT token. The token is automatically saved to the collection variable `jwt_token` for use in subsequent requests.

#### Request Body

- `email` (string): User's email address
- `password` (string): User's plain text password

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

```json
{
    "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...",
    "user": {
        "userId": 1,
        "firstName": "Admin",
        "lastName": "User",
        "email": "admin@example.com",
        "role": "admin",
        "organizationId": null
    }
}
```

**Note:** The JWT token expires after 24 hours. Use the token in the Authorization header for protected endpoints: `Authorization: Bearer <token>`

### Get All Users

Retrieves a list of all users. **Requires admin authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Admin only

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array of user objects with the following properties:

- `userId` (number): Unique identifier
- `firstName` (string): User's first name
- `lastName` (string): User's last name
- `email` (string): User's email address
- `passwordHash` (string): Hashed password (for security)
- `role` (string): User role (volunteer, organizer, or admin)
- `lastLogin` (string | null): Timestamp of last login
- `createdAt` (string): Account creation timestamp
- `updatedAt` (string): Last update timestamp
- `organizationId` (number | null): Associated organization ID (for organizers)

### Get User Details

Retrieves details of a specific user. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Users can view their own data, organizers can view limited data (userId, firstName, lastName, email) of any user, admins can view full data of any user

#### Path Parameters

- `user_id` (integer): The unique identifier of the user

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array with one user object. Organizers viewing other users will receive limited data:

```json
[
  {
    "userId": 1,
    "firstName": "John",
    "lastName": "Doe",
    "email": "john@example.com",
    "passwordHash": "$2b$10$...",
    "role": "volunteer",
    "lastLogin": "2025-01-15T10:30:00.000Z",
    "createdAt": "2025-01-01T00:00:00.000Z",
    "updatedAt": "2025-01-15T10:30:00.000Z",
    "organizationId": null
  }
]
```

### Get User by Email

Retrieves user information by email address. **Requires admin authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Admin only

#### Path Parameters

- `email` (string): The email address of the user

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array of user objects matching the email (case-insensitive).

### Register User

Registers a new user account. **Public endpoint - no authentication required.**

#### Request Body

- `firstName` (string, required): The first name of the user (1-50 characters, letters, spaces, hyphens, apostrophes only)
- `lastName` (string, required): The last name of the user (1-50 characters, letters, spaces, hyphens, apostrophes only)
- `email` (string, required): The email address of the user (must be unique, max 150 characters)
- `password` (string, required): **Plain text password** (8-100 characters, must contain uppercase, lowercase, number, and special character @$!%*?&)
- `role` (string, optional): The role of the user (volunteer, organizer, or admin). Defaults to 'volunteer'
- `organizationId` (number, optional): Organization ID to link user to (for organizers)

#### Password Requirements

- Minimum 8 characters, maximum 100 characters
- Must contain at least one uppercase letter
- Must contain at least one lowercase letter
- Must contain at least one number
- Must contain at least one special character: @$!%*?&

#### Response

- Status: 201 Created
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with `insertId` of the created user.

**Note:** The password is automatically hashed using bcrypt on the backend before storage.

### Update User Details

Updates an existing user's information. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Users can update their own profile, admins can update any user

#### Request Body

- `userId` (number, required): The unique identifier of the user to update
- `firstName` (string, optional): Updated first name
- `lastName` (string, optional): Updated last name
- `email` (string, optional): Updated email address (must be unique)
- `password` (string, optional): **Plain text password** (if provided, must meet complexity requirements and will be hashed)
- `role` (string, optional): Updated role
- `organizationId` (number, optional): Updated organization ID

#### Password Requirements (if updating password)

- Minimum 8 characters, maximum 100 characters
- Must contain uppercase, lowercase, number, and special character (@$!%*?&)

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with update confirmation.

**Note:** If password is provided, it is automatically hashed using bcrypt before storage.

### Delete User by ID

Deletes a specific user. **Requires admin authentication.** If the user is an organizer with an associated organization, the organization is also deleted.

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Admin only

#### Path Parameters

- `userId` (integer): The unique identifier of the user to delete

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with deletion confirmation.

### Link User to Organization

Links a user to an organization and sets their role to 'organizer' if not already. **Requires admin authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Admin only

#### Path Parameters

- `userId` (integer): The unique identifier of the user to link

#### Request Body

- `organizationId` (number, required): The ID of the organization to link the user to

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns confirmation message with userId and organizationId.

### Get All Events

Retrieves a list of all events. **Public endpoint - no authentication required.**

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array of event objects with the following properties:

- `eventId` (number): Unique identifier
- `title` (string): Event title
- `description` (string): Event description
- `eventDate` (string): Event date (YYYY-MM-DD)
- `eventTime` (string): Event time (HH:MM format)
- `eventLengthHours` (number): Duration of event in hours (1-24)
- `locationName` (string): Name of the location
- `address` (string): Street address
- `city` (string): City
- `state` (string): State (2-letter code)
- `numNeeded` (number): Number of volunteers needed
- `numSignedUp` (number): Number of volunteers signed up
- `createdBy` (number): User ID of event creator
- `organizationId` (number): Organization hosting the event

### Get Event Details

Retrieves details of a specific event by ID. **Public endpoint - no authentication required.**

#### Path Parameters

- `eventId` (integer): The unique identifier of the event

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array with one event object. Includes all event fields including `eventLengthHours`.

### Search Events

Searches events by optional filters (city, state, date, organization). **Public endpoint - no authentication required.**

#### Query Parameters (all optional)

- `city` (string): Filter by city name
- `state` (string): Filter by state (2-letter code, e.g., "CA")
- `date` (string): Filter by event date (ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD)
- `organizationId` (number): Filter by organization ID

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array of matching event objects. All query parameters are optional - you can use any combination or none at all.

body.raw:
{
    "title": "Beach Cleanup",
    "description": "Join us in cleaning up the beach to help the environment.",
    "eventDate": "2025-03-01",
    "eventTime": "09:00",
    "eventLengthHours": 4,
    "locationName": "Pacific Beach",
    "address": "123 Beach Blvd, San Diego, CA",
    "city": "San Diego",
    "state": "CA",
    "numNeeded": 20,
    "numSignedUp": 0,
    "createdBy": 1,
    "organizationId": 1
}

request.description:
### Create New Event

Creates a new event. **Requires authentication.** The associated organization must have 'approved' status.

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Organizer for the organization or Admin

#### Request Body

- `title` (string, required): Event title (1-200 characters)
- `description` (string, required): Event description (1-2000 characters)
- `eventDate` (string, required): Event date in format 'YYYY-MM-DD'
- `eventTime` (string, required): Event time in format 'HH:MM' (24-hour)
- `eventLengthHours` (number, optional): Duration in hours (1-24)
- `locationName` (string, required): Name of location (1-200 characters)
- `address` (string, required): Street address (1-200 characters)
- `city` (string, required): City name (1-100 characters)
- `state` (string, required): State code (2 uppercase letters, e.g., "CA")
- `numNeeded` (number, required): Number of volunteers needed (1-10000)
- `numSignedUp` (number, optional): Current signups (defaults to 0)
- `createdBy` (number, required): User ID of creator
- `organizationId` (number, required): Organization hosting the event

#### Response

- Status: 201 Created
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with `insertId` of the created event.

**Note:** Event creation will fail (403) if the organization's approval status is 'pending' or 'rejected'.

    "city": "San Diego",
    "state": "CA",
    "numNeeded": 25,
    "numSignedUp": 5,
    "createdBy": 1,
    "organizationId": 1
}

request.description:
### Update Event

Updates an existing event. **Requires authentication.** The associated organization must have 'approved' status.

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Organizer for the event's organization or Admin

#### Request Body

- `eventId` (number, required): The unique identifier of the event to update
- `title` (string, optional): Updated title
- `description` (string, optional): Updated description
- `eventDate` (string, optional): Updated date (YYYY-MM-DD)
- `eventTime` (string, optional): Updated time (HH:MM format)
- `eventLengthHours` (number, optional): Updated duration in hours (1-24)
- `locationName` (string, optional): Updated location name
- `address` (string, optional): Updated address
- `city` (string, optional): Updated city
- `state` (string, optional): Updated state (2-letter code)
- `numNeeded` (number, optional): Updated volunteers needed
- `numSignedUp` (number, optional): Updated signups count
- `createdBy` (number, optional): Creator user ID
- `organizationId` (number, optional): Organization ID

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with update confirmation.

**Note:** Event update will fail (403) if the organization's approval status is 'pending' or 'rejected'.

### Delete Event

Deletes a specific event. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Organizer for the event's organization or Admin

#### Path Parameters

- `eventId` (integer): The unique identifier of the event to delete

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with deletion confirmation.

### Get All Organizations

Retrieves a list of all organizations. **Public endpoint - no authentication required.**

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array of organization objects with the following properties:

- `organizationId` (number): Unique identifier
- `name` (string): Organization name
- `description` (string | null): Organization description
- `contactEmail` (string): Contact email
- `contactPhone` (string | null): Contact phone
- `website` (string | null): Website URL
- `approvalStatus` (string): Approval status ('pending', 'approved', or 'rejected')
- `approvedBy` (number | null): User ID of admin who approved/rejected
- `approvedAt` (string | null): Timestamp of approval/rejection
- `rejectionReason` (string | null): Reason for rejection (if rejected)
- `createdAt` (string): Creation timestamp
- `updatedAt` (string): Last update timestamp

### Get Organization by ID

Retrieves details of a specific organization by ID. **Public endpoint - no authentication required.**

#### Path Parameters

- `organization_id` (integer): The unique identifier of the organization

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array with one organization object. Includes all organization fields including approval status information.

### Get Organization by Name

Retrieves an organization by its name. **Public endpoint - no authentication required.**

#### Path Parameters

- `name` (string): The name of the organization

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK (if found) or 404 Not Found
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns a single organization object if found, or 404 error if not found.

body.raw:
{
    "name": "Helping Hands milestone 3",
    "description": "A community-driven organization focused on volunteering efforts.",
    "contactEmail": "info@helpinghands.org",
    "contactPhone": "555-123-4567",
    "website": "https://helpinghands.org"
}

request.description:
### Create Organization

Creates a new organization. **Requires authentication.** Approval status defaults to 'pending'. Optionally links a user to the organization.

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Organizer or Admin

#### Request Body

- `name` (string, required): Organization name (1-200 characters, must be unique)
- `description` (string, optional): Organization description (max 1000 characters)
- `contactEmail` (string, required): Contact email (valid email format, max 150 characters)
- `contactPhone` (string, optional): Contact phone (max 20 characters)
- `website` (string, optional): Website URL (valid URL format, max 200 characters)
- `userId` (number, optional): User ID to link to this organization (sets user as organizer)

#### Response

- Status: 201 Created
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns JSON object with `organizationId` (from `insertId`) and optional `userLinked` information if userId was provided.

**Note:** New organizations are created with `approvalStatus: 'pending'` and must be approved by an admin before they can create events.

body.raw:
{
    "organizationId": 1,
    "name": "Helping Hands - Updated",
    "description": "A community-driven organization focused on volunteering efforts.",
    "contactEmail": "info@helpinghands.org",
    "contactPhone": "555-123-4567",
    "website": "https://helpinghands.org"
}

request.description:
### Update Organization

Updates an existing organization. **Requires authentication.** Regular fields can be updated by organizers/admins. Approval status fields can only be updated by admins.

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Organizer for the organization or Admin

#### Request Body (Regular Fields)

- `organizationId` (number, required): The unique identifier of the organization
- `name` (string, optional): Updated name
- `description` (string, optional): Updated description
- `contactEmail` (string, optional): Updated contact email
- `contactPhone` (string, optional): Updated contact phone
- `website` (string, optional): Updated website URL

#### Request Body (Approval Status - Admin Only)

- `organizationId` (number, required): The unique identifier of the organization
- `approvalStatus` (string, required): New status ('pending', 'approved', or 'rejected')
- `rejectionReason` (string, optional): Reason for rejection (required if status is 'rejected', set to null if 'approved' or 'pending')

**Note:** When updating approval status, `approvedBy` and `approvedAt` are automatically set. If status is 'approved' or 'pending', `rejectionReason` is automatically set to null.

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with update confirmation.

### Delete Organization

Deletes a specific organization. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Organizer for the organization or Admin

#### Path Parameters

- `organizationId` (integer): The unique identifier of the organization to delete

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with deletion confirmation.

### Get All Signups

Retrieves a list of all signups. **Requires admin authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Admin only

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array of signup objects with:

- `signupId` (number): Unique identifier
- `userId` (number): User who signed up
- `eventId` (number): Event signed up for
- `signupDate` (string): Date of signup
- `status` (string): Signup status ('registered' or 'canceled')

### Get User Signups

Retrieves all signups for a specific user. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Authenticated users

#### Path Parameters

- `userId` (integer): The unique identifier of the user

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array of signup objects for the specified user.

### Get Signups for Event

Retrieves all signups for a specific event. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Authenticated users

#### Path Parameters

- `eventId` (integer): The unique identifier of the event

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array of signup objects for the specified event.

### Register User for Event

Registers a user for an event. **Requires authentication.** Automatically increments the event's signup count.

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Authenticated users

#### Request Body

- `userId` (number, required): The ID of the user registering
- `eventId` (number, required): The ID of the event to register for

**Note:** `signupDate` and `status` are automatically set to current date and 'registered' respectively.

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with `insertId` of the created signup.

**Error:** Returns 400 if user is already signed up for this event.

### Delete Signup (De-register)

De-registers a user from an event. **Requires authentication.** Automatically decrements the event's signup count.

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Authenticated users

#### Path Parameters

- `signupId` (integer): The unique identifier of the signup to delete

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with deletion confirmation.

### Get All Support Messages

Retrieves all support messages. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Authenticated users

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array of support message objects with:

- `messageId` (number): Unique identifier
- `userId` (number | null): User ID if logged in
- `name` (string): Sender's name
- `email` (string): Sender's email
- `subject` (string): Message subject
- `message` (string): Message content
- `isResolved` (number): 0 = unresolved, 1 = resolved
- `respondedBy` (number | null): User ID who responded
- `responseMessage` (string | null): Response content
- `createdAt` (string): Creation timestamp
- `respondedAt` (string | null): Response timestamp

### Get Support Message by ID

Retrieves a specific support message. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Authenticated users

#### Path Parameters

- `messageId` (integer): The unique identifier of the message

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK or 404 Not Found
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns a single support message object.

### Create Support Message

Creates a new support message. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Authenticated users

#### Request Body

- `name` (string, required): Sender's name (1-100 characters)
- `email` (string, required): Sender's email (valid email format, max 150 characters)
- `subject` (string, required): Message subject (1-200 characters)
- `message` (string, required): Message content (1-5000 characters)
- `userId` (number, optional): User ID if logged in (automatically set from token)

#### Response

- Status: 201 Created
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with `insertId` of the created message.

### Update Support Message

Updates a support message (typically to mark as resolved and add a response). **Public endpoint - no authentication required.**

#### Request Body

- `isResolved` (number, optional): 0 = unresolved, 1 = resolved
- `responseMessage` (string, optional): Response content (max 5000 characters)
- `respondedBy` (number, optional): User ID of responder (if authenticated)

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with update confirmation.

**Note:** If `isResolved` is set to 1 and `responseMessage` is provided, `respondedAt` is automatically set to current timestamp.

### Delete Support Message

Deletes a support message. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Authenticated users

#### Path Parameters

- `messageId` (integer): The unique identifier of the message to delete

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with deletion confirmation.

### Get Event Signups with Attendance

Retrieves all signups for an event with their attendance status. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Organizer for the event's organization or Admin

#### Path Parameters

- `eventId` (integer): The unique identifier of the event

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array of objects with:

- `signupId` (number): Signup identifier
- `userId` (number): User ID
- `eventId` (number): Event ID
- `signupDate` (string): Date of signup
- `status` (string): Signup status
- `attendance` (object | null): Attendance record if marked
  - `attendanceId` (number): Attendance identifier
  - `signupId` (number): Signup ID
  - `markedBy` (number): User who marked attendance
  - `markedAt` (string): Timestamp when marked
  - `hours` (number | null): Hours volunteered
  - `status` (string): 'completed', 'no_show', or 'excused'

### Get Attendance by Signup ID

Retrieves attendance record for a specific signup. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Authenticated users

#### Path Parameters

- `signupId` (integer): The unique identifier of the signup

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK or 404 Not Found
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns attendance object if found, or 404 if no attendance record exists.

### Mark Attendance

Marks attendance for a signup. Creates a new record or updates existing one. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Organizer for the event's organization or Admin

#### Request Body

- `signupId` (number, required): The signup identifier
- `hours` (number, optional): Hours volunteered (0-24)
- `status` (string, required): 'completed', 'no_show', or 'excused'

**Note:** `markedBy` is automatically set from the authenticated user's ID, and `markedAt` is set to current timestamp.

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK or 201 Created
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with `insertId` or update confirmation.

### Update Attendance

Updates an existing attendance record. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Organizer for the event's organization or Admin

#### Path Parameters

- `attendanceId` (integer): The unique identifier of the attendance record

#### Request Body

- `hours` (number, optional): Updated hours volunteered (0-24)
- `status` (string, optional): Updated status ('completed', 'no_show', or 'excused')

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with update confirmation.

### Delete Attendance Record

Deletes an attendance record. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Organizer for the event's organization or Admin

#### Path Parameters

- `attendanceId` (integer): The unique identifier of the attendance record to delete

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with deletion confirmation.

### Get All Certificates

Retrieves all certificates. **Public endpoint - no authentication required.**

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array of certificate objects (without `verificationHash` for security):

- `certificateId` (number): Unique identifier
- `signupId` (number): Associated signup ID
- `certificateUid` (string): Unique certificate identifier (e.g., "VS-77U7-LDDW")
- `issuedAt` (string): Issue timestamp
- `signedBy` (number | null): User ID who signed/issued
- `pdfPath` (string | null): Path to PDF certificate file

### Get Certificate by ID

Retrieves a specific certificate by ID. **Public endpoint - no authentication required.**

#### Path Parameters

- `certificateId` (integer): The unique identifier of the certificate

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK or 404 Not Found
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns a single certificate object (without `verificationHash`).

### Get Certificates by User ID

Retrieves all certificates for a specific user. **Public endpoint - no authentication required.**

#### Path Parameters

- `userId` (integer): The unique identifier of the user

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array of certificate objects for the specified user.

### Get Certificates by Event ID

Retrieves all certificates for a specific event. **Public endpoint - no authentication required.**

#### Path Parameters

- `eventId` (integer): The unique identifier of the event

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns an array of certificate objects for the specified event.

### Get Certificate by UID

Retrieves a certificate by its unique identifier (UID). **Public endpoint - no authentication required.** Verifies the certificate hash to ensure authenticity.

#### Path Parameters

- `certificateUid` (string): The unique certificate identifier (e.g., "VS-77U7-LDDW")

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK or 404 Not Found or 403 Forbidden (if hash verification fails)
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns a formatted certificate object with nested user, event, organization, and attendance information (without `verificationHash`).

### Verify Certificate

Public endpoint for verifying a certificate by UID. Same as GET by UID but specifically for verification purposes. **Public endpoint - no authentication required.**

#### Path Parameters

- `certificateUid` (string): The unique certificate identifier

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK (valid), 404 Not Found, or 403 Forbidden (tampered)
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns formatted certificate information if valid and verified.

### Create Certificate

Creates a new certificate for a signup. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Organizer for the event's organization or Admin

#### Request Body

- `signupId` (number, required): The signup identifier
- `certificateUid` (string, required): Unique certificate identifier (must be unique, e.g., "VS-XXXX-XXXX")
- `verificationHash` (string, required): SHA-256 hash of the certificate UID for verification
- `pdfPath` (string, optional): Path to PDF certificate file

**Note:** `signedBy` is automatically set from the authenticated user's ID, and `issuedAt` is set to current timestamp.

#### Response

- Status: 201 Created
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns JSON object with `certificateId` (from `insertId`) and other fields.

### Update Certificate

Updates an existing certificate. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Organizer for the event's organization or Admin

#### Path Parameters

- `certificateId` (integer): The unique identifier of the certificate

#### Request Body

- `certificateUid` (string, optional): Updated certificate UID (must be unique)
- `verificationHash` (string, optional): Updated verification hash
- `pdfPath` (string, optional): Updated PDF path

**Note:** `signedBy` is automatically updated to the authenticated user's ID.

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with update confirmation.

### Delete Certificate

Deletes a certificate. **Requires authentication.**

#### Authentication

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer <jwt_token>`
- Access: Organizer for the event's organization or Admin

#### Path Parameters

- `certificateId` (integer): The unique identifier of the certificate to delete

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- Content-Type: application/json

Returns MySQL result packet with deletion confirmation.
